actions.name: DoConfigure
actions.description: Set common execution parameters and limitations.

system_prompt.description: Additional prompt to be used for all interactions.

token_limit.description: Token limit to be used for whole prompt.

max_tokens.description: Maximum amount of tokens per response.

timeout.description: LLM provider to use for Robot: `bedrock` or `openai`.

actions.name: SetSelfCheck
actions.description:
Add a the following system prompt:
After each step, take a screenshot and carefully evaluate if you have achieved the right outcome. Explicitly show your thinking: "I have evaluated step X..." If not correct, try again. Only when you confirm a step was executed correctly should you move on to the next one.
As recommended here:
https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/build-with-claude/computer-use#optimize-model-performance-with-prompting

actions.name: DoWebBrowser

prompt.description: Clear explanation of what you want AiRobot to do with a given target.

token_limit.description: Token limit to be used for whole prompt.

max_tokens.description: Maximum amount of tokens per response.

actions.name: DoObject
actions.signature: /**string*/ prompt, /**objectid|SeSObject*/ objectId, /**number*/ timeout, /**number*/ n_last_images, /**number*/ max_tokens, /**number*/ token_limit

prompt.description: Clear explanation of what you want AiRobot to do with a given target.

object_id.description: Object whose screen rectangle will be shown to AI robot to interact with.

token_limit.description: Token limit to be used for whole prompt.

max_tokens.description: Maximum amount of tokens per response.

timeout.description: LLM provider to use for Robot: `bedrock` or `openai`.

AiRobot.description:
AiRobot. Implements fully-automatic interactions with target window or screen region (keyboard and mouse). Should be used when AI is unable to
find reasonable entries in other page objects. This way of interacting is last resort. It may be applied to complex, exploratory style actions.

actions.name: SetDefaultWorkflow
actions.description: Sets default workflow.

workflow.description: Name or Id of the workflow to set as default.

actions.name: LogSessions
actions.description: Enables/disables session logging.

b.description: If `true` - a session will be created for each AI request. Review the sessions in the AI Dashboard.

actions.name: StackWebImage
actions.description: Adds browser screenshot to the batch to send along with the AiTester.DoMultiImageQuery.

actions.name: StackImage
actions.description: Adds a screenshot to the batch to send along with the AiTester.DoMultiImageQuery.

actions.name: StackImageFile
actions.description: Adds a screenshot file to the batch to send along with the AiTester.DoMultiImageQuery.

actions.name: DoTextQuery
actions.description: Sends a text query to AI model using specified or default workflow.

workflow.description: Name or Id of the workflow to use. Default value is `AI Chat`. You may set the workflow with AiTester.SetDefaultWorkflow.

actions.name: DoWebImageVerify
actions.description: Sends a text query along with a browser screenshot to AI model using specified or default workflow. Verifies the result.

assertion.description: Assertion to test against the response.

workflow.description: Name or Id of the workflow to use. Default value is `AI Chat`. You may set the workflow with AiTester.SetDefaultWorkflow.

actions.name: DoWebImageQuery
actions.description: Sends a text query along with a browser screenshot to AI model using specified or default workflow.

workflow.description: Name or Id of the workflow to use. Default value is `AI Chat`. You may set the workflow with AiTester.SetDefaultWorkflow.

actions.name: DoMultiImageQuery
actions.description: Sends a text query along with the set of images added via AiTester.StackWebImage. Clears the stack after the query.

workflow.description: Name or Id of the workflow to use. Default value is `AI Chat`. You may set the workflow with AiTester.SetDefaultWorkflow.

actions.name: DoImageQuery
actions.description: Sends a text query along with an image to AI model using specified or default workflow.

workflow.description: Name or Id of the workflow to use. Default value is `AI Chat`. You may set the workflow with AiTester.SetDefaultWorkflow.

actions.name: DoObjectQuery
actions.description: Sends a text query along with a screenshot of an object to AI model using specified or default workflow.

objectId.description: ID of an object in the object repository.

workflow.description: Name or Id of the workflow to use. Default value is `AI Chat`. You may set the workflow with AiTester.SetDefaultWorkflow.

actions.name: DoWindowQuery
actions.description: Sends a text query along with a screenshot of a window with the given title to AI model using specified or default workflow.

workflow.description: Name or Id of the workflow to use. Default value is `AI Chat`. You may set the workflow with AiTester.SetDefaultWorkflow.

actions.name: DoFullScreenQuery
actions.description: Sends a text query along with a screenshot of a desktop to AI model using specified or default workflow.

workflow.description: Name or Id of the workflow to use. Default value is `AI Chat`. You may set the workflow with AiTester.SetDefaultWorkflow.

actions.description: Tests assertion against the text.

assertion.description: Assertion to test against the response.

actions.description: Tests assertion against the last response.

actions.name: SoftAssert
actions.description: Tests soft assertion against the response.

assertion.description: Assertion to test against the response.

actions.name: SoftAssertLastResponse
actions.description: Tests soft assertion against the last response.

assertion.description: Assertion to test against the response.

actions.name: DoAnalyzeReport
actions.description: Analyzes TRP report and provides root cause analysis.

AiTester.description:
AiTester. Enables AI capabilities during test case execution. Use AiTester to generate data,
perform image-based assertions (such as finding discrepancies and analyzing displayed content), and handle
other tasks that require AI processing.

ExtentReports.description:
ExtentReports provides JS interface to support for extentreports-csharp library. But the main thing is that it overrides SeSOnReportMessage and generates html-based ExtentReports report instead of default Rapise report.
@see https://www.inflectra.com/Support/KnowledgeBase/KB861.aspx

actions.name: PressAlt
actions.description:
@PageObject KeyboardHelper provides handy way for pressing/releasing modified keys.
@Version 1.0.1

KeyboardHelper.description: KeyboardHelper provides handy way for pressing/releasing modified keys.

actions.name: VerifyMenu
actions.description: Verify that `menuContents` has all lines/items from `expected` and nothing else.

actions.name: VerifyMenuContains
actions.description: Verify that `menuContents` has all lines/items from `expected` and maybe something else.

actions.name: CompareToDropdown
actions.description: Check that dropdown with `idList` defined in Dropdowns.xlsx has equals `menuContents` (has all same items, maybe in different order).

actions.name: GetDropdownList
actions.description:
Return values of dropdown with id `idList` as array of strings. The list is taken
from %WORKDIR%\Dropdowns.xlsx unless optional `xlsPath` is specified.

ListChecker.description:
ListChecker helps comparing multiline strings with lists and dropdowns.
Expected list may be an array or also a multiline list. It may come from application,
from variable or from Dropdowns.

actions.name: PressModalButton
FindModalDialog
ContextMenuSelect
actions.description:
Click menu item in the context menu by given `path`. When `path` is not set,
return full contents of the context menu as list

actions.name: GetContextMenuObject
actions.description: Return ManagedObject representing currently visible context menu

actions.name: WaitForPopup
actions.description:
Check for managed popup window with given `caption` to show up on the screen.
Limit check with `timeout`.

ManagedHelper.description:
ManagedHelper handy methods for popup dialogs and context menus.
- Work with popup dialogs (wait for appearance)
- Click context menu
- Return context menu items as list

actions.name: GetFullText
actions.description: Parse PDF at `pdfPath` and return its text representation for further processing

actions.name: Contains
actions.description: Parse PDF at `pdfPath` and check if it contains `textOrRegexp` value.
actions.returns: `true` if text present in the PDF.

textOrRegexp.description: Either plain string, or something starting from regex: to look in the file

actions.name: AssertContains
actions.description:
Parse PDF at `pdfPath` and check if it contains `textOrRegexp` value writing 
writing to the report as `assertionMessage`.

textOrRegexp.description: Either plain string, or something starting from regex: to look in the file

assertionMessage.description: Line to write to the report

PDF.description: PDF handling: read text, check that PDF contains some text, assert PDF contains something.

actions.name: DoPlay
DoInvoke
DoImportJsonReport

actions.name: GetElementByAi

Playwright.description: Playwright.DoInvoke(async callBack({page,expect})=>{...}). Allow playwright to attach to currently running browser (with Navigator.Open) and do something using Playwright.

actions.name: ConvertAICommandRepository
actions.description:
Converts AI Command structure to new format: 
Single ai.commands.json per Test Case/Page Object located in the same folder
as an RVL file that contains these commands.

actions.name: CleanTempFiles
actions.description:
Clean the following temp files and folders:
.tap
.trp
out.log
err.log
play.cmd
Report/*

actions.name: CleanAICommandCache
actions.description: Cleans AI cache, removes unused commands from ai.commands.json files.

actions.name: CleanAICommandCacheDeprecated
actions.description: Cleans AI cache, removes unused .json files from AI\commands folder.

actions.name: GetRapiseApp
actions.description: Get RapiseApp object representing instance of Rapise running this test case.

actions.name: DoImportManual
actions.description: Loads test case hierarchy recursively

RapiseUtils.description: RapiseUtils provides various actions to perform framework-oriented tasks.

actions.name: Launch
actions.description: Launches Salesforce in a browser. SfdcUrl, UserName, Password must be set in Config.xlsx

actions.name: OpenApp

Opens application.
@param app Name of an application (e.g. Service, Marketing, Sales).

Navigates to module using nav bar.

@param view Name of a view. E.g. Recently Viewed, All Open Leads

actions.name: SetTextField
SearchTable

actions.name: SelectComboboxItem
SaveDom

Sfdc.description: Sfdc object to perform common actions like launch, navigate module, etc.

actions.name: CheckPattern
actions.description:
Compare `str` with `pattern`. Pattern may contain fields defined in the `defObj`.
`defObj` is a structure:
{
f: "<range of values>"
}
so each time 'f' is found in the pattern, it will be matched agains <range of values>.
Example:
StringChecker.CheckPattern('1-X', 'N-L', {N:"0123456789", L:"XYZ"});
Will check that:
- 1 is a number 
- '-' is exactly '-' (because it it is not a defined field)
- X belongs to range X,Y or Z.
Function returns true if `str` matches the `pattern`. Otherwise it return false and global variable PMResult contains detailed information about the difference.

actions.name: VerifyPattern
actions.description:
Match pattern using 'StringChecker.CheckPattern' and do an assertion for the result. `message` is an assertion message.
When match is failed, detailed information about the difference is saved to the report.

actions.name: CheckPatternRVL
actions.description:
Match pattern using 'StringChecker.CheckPattern'. The function returns `true` if match is successfull.
This version of function is dedicated to be used from RVL. Additional pattern fields may be passed as additional parameters (RVL array params).

actions.name: VerifyPatternRVL
actions.description:
Match pattern using 'StringChecker.CheckPattern' and do an assertion for the result. `message` is an assertion message.
When match is failed, detailed information about the difference is saved to the report.
This version of function is dedicated to be used from RVL. Additional pattern fields may be passed as additional parameters (RVL array params).

actions.name: CheckRegex
actions.description:
Check if `str` matches given regular expression. Match means the 
whole `str` is covered by regexp.
If match is partial, it is assumed that there is no match. For example:
ABC matches A.*
but
ABC does not match AB (because it is partial match, not covering trailing C)
If you pass in the RegExp object as `regexstr`, then match will be done using RegExp.test function. I.e. it may be either partial or full match depending on use of ^ and $.
Function returns true if `str` matches the `regexstr`. Otherwise it return `false`.

actions.name: VerifyRegex
actions.description:
Verify that `str` matches given regular expression `regexstr` using StringChecker.CheckRegex.
When match is failed, detailed information about the difference is saved to the report.
This version of function is dedicated to be used from RVL. Additional pattern fields may be passed as additional parameters (RVL array params).

actions.name: CheckUnique
actions.description:
Check that given `val` is unique. I.e. it differs from all known previous values.
Function returns `true` if `val` is unique, `false` otherwise.

actions.name: VerifyUnique
actions.description: Verify that given `val` is unique. Write result to the report with provided `message`.

actions.name: CheckContainsOneOf
actions.description:
Check that given `val` contains at least one symbol from given string of `chars`.
Function returns `true` if `val` is unique, `false` otherwise.

actions.name: VerifyContainsOneOf
actions.description: Verify that given `val` contains at least one symbol from given string of `chars`. Write result to the report with provided `message`.

actions.name: CheckMatchesOneOf
actions.description:
Check that given `val` matches (i.e. equals or regex: matches) one of `values`. Values list may be an array or also a multiline list (i.e. \n-separated string).
Function returns `true` if `val` is found among `values`, `false` otherwise.

actions.name: VerifyMatchesOneOf
actions.description: Check that given `val` matches (i.e. equals or regex: matches) one of `values`. Values list may be an array or also a multiline list (i.e. \n-separated string). Write result to the report with provided `message`.

actions.name: CheckContainsNoneOf
actions.description:
Check that given `val` contains none of symbols from given string of `chars`.
Function returns `true` if `val` is unique, `false` otherwise.

actions.name: VerifyContainsNoneOf
actions.description: Verify that given `val` contains none of symbols from given string of `chars`. Write result to the report with provided `message`.

StringChecker.description: StringChecker helps comparing strings with regular patterns.

actions.name: GetRowCount
actions.description: Get number of <tr> rows in the table

actions.name: DoClickCell
actions.description: @paraminfo

colId.description: Column caption for a cell to click in

actions.name: VerifyRow
actions.description: Find a row containing `rowText` and check that it also has cell having `otherText`.

TableHandler.description:
TableHandler makes it easy to work with
based tables.

actions.name: DoAnalyzeReport
actions.description: Analyzes TRP report and provides root cause analysis.

actions.name: DoAnalyzeFailuresFor
actions.description:
Discovers failed test sets, corresponding test runs and executes root cause analysis for each failed test case.
@returns Path to generated summary PDF document.

projectNameOrId.description: Name or Id of a project in Spira to query.

testSetNamesOrIds.description: Test set Name or Id, or comma-separated list of Names/Ids, or an array of Names/Ids

summaryReportName.description: Name for the summary report file (without extension).

actions.name: DoAnalyzeFailuresRvl
actions.description:
Discovers failed test sets, corresponding test runs and executes root cause analysis for each failed test case.
@returns Path to generated summary PDF document.

rvlPath.description: Path to RVL script that triggers Spira.RunTestSet actions.

summaryReportName.description: Name for the summary report file (without extension).

actions.name: DoRerunFailedAndNotRun
actions.description: Discovers test sets triggered with `Spira.RunTestSet` in a given RVL script, and reruns those that were not executed or failed on the day of running this action. If `rvlPath` is not set then executing RVL script is scanned. Returns the number of scheduled test sets.

rvlPath.description: Path to RVL script that triggers Spira.RunTestSet actions.

actions.name: DoAiReport
actions.description: Sends the query to AI along with the test execution data.

baseName.description: Base name for the input data file.

actions.name: DoAiReportPy
actions.description: Sends the query to AI to generate a file with Python code, then runs the code. Python file name is <baseName>.py.

baseName.description: Base name for the input data file.

promptFileName.description: Name of a .txt file with the base prompt to use. User query is appended to the end of the prompt.

actions.name: DoAiReportHtml
actions.description: Sends the query to AI to generate HTML report. Report file name is <baseName>Report.html.

baseName.description: Base name for the input data file.

promptFileName.description: Name of a .txt file with the base prompt to use. User query is appended to the end of the prompt.

actions.name: DoMarkdownToPdf
actions.description: Converts Markdown to PDF and opens the result.

open.description: Set to `true` to open the result once generated.

actions.name: DoTrpToPdf
actions.description: Converts TRP to PDF.

actions.name: DoAnalyzeRunHistory
actions.description: Queries test run history from Spira and saves data for further use by DoAiReport* actions.
actions.signature: /**string*/ projectNameOrId, /**boolean*/ automated, /**number*/ days, /**number*/ batchSize, /**boolean*/ failuresOnly, /**string*/ baseName

projectNameOrId.description: Name or Id of a project in Spira to query.

automated.description: If `true`, query automated test runs; otherwise, query manual.

days.description: Query all test runs not older than the specified number of days.

batchSize.description: Number of test runs to query in each batch request. Change to achieve better performance.

failuresOnly.description: Process only those test runs that did not pass.

baseName.description: Base name for intermediate data files.

actions.name: DoAnalyzeFlakyTestCases
actions.description: Discovers flaky tests and saves their test run data for further use by  DoAiReport* actions.
actions.signature: /**string*/ projectNameOrId, /**boolean*/ automated, /**number*/ runCount, /**number*/ batchSize, /**number*/ tcCount, /**string*/ baseName

projectNameOrId.description: Name or Id of a project in Spira to query.

automated.description: If `true` - query automated test runs, otherwise query manual.

runCount.description: Number of recent test runs to query.

batchSize.description: Number of test runs to query in each batch request. Change to achieve better performance.

tcCount.description: Number of top flaky test cases to analyze.

baseName.description: Base name for intermediate data files.

actions.name: DoSaveFileToSpira
actions.description: Creates a document in Spira. Use it to attach generated reports.

projectNameOrId.description: Name or Id of a project in Spira.

documentFolderId.description: Id of a document folder in Spira.

path.description: Path to a file to save.

documentName.description: Name for the document in Spira. If a name is not specified, it is derived from the input file name.

timestamp.description: Add timestamp to the document name.

name.description:
Parameter name. Supported names are:
  - ExcludeFromAnalysis - comma-separated list of Test Case names to exclude
  - MinNumberOfTestRuns - if a test case has less than this specified number of runs then it will be excluded from DoAnalyzeFlakyTestCases. Default value is 10.
  - BaseName - set this property to avoid passing it explicitly to various methods of TestRunner. Some methods that generate data will prepend the base name to the file names they produce. Also, TestRunner.DoAiReport* methods will grab data from the files with this prefix.

actions.name: DoDailySummaryReport
actions.description: Discovers all test sets triggered by Spira.RunTestSet from a given RVL script and builds execution summary report for current date.

rvlPath.description: Path to RVL script that triggers Spira.RunTestSet actions.

summaryReportName.description: Name for the summary report file (without extension).

TestRunner.description:
TestRunner. Allows to easily rerun failed tests. 
Helps to analyze failures, flaky test cases  and generate reports and graphs.

actions.name: GetFullPageText
actions.description:
Returns string containing all visible text on the current page.
Example:
var page = WebPageHelper.GetFullPageText();
Tester.AssertContains('Welcome message found on the page', page, 'Welcome, Friend!')

actions.name: GetXPathItemsAsList
CheckPageContains
actions.description:
Check that page contains given `textToFind`. This action does not write to the report
and simply returns `true` when text was found and `false` otherwise. You may pass the result
to the assertion or if statement.
Example:
if( WebPageHelper.CheckPageContains('Welcome, Friend!') ) {
Already logged in, need to log out first.
}

actions.name: CheckVisible
actions.returns: 'true' if the upload was successful; otherwise, it returns false.

objIdXPathLabelText.description: The target element to click. This can be an object reference or an XPath selector string or element id or `css=<some css>` or `//xpath` or label (<label for=>***</label> or aria-label=***).

actions.name: VerifyVisible
VerifyPageContains
actions.description:
Check that page contains given `textToFind` and write Pass or Fail to the report
accordingly
Example:
WebPageHelper.VerifyPageContains('Page must have welcome message', 'Welcome, Friend!');

actions.name: DoClickByText
actions.description: Find an element by text and click on it. Take into account only element text.

actions.name: DoClickByPlaceholder
actions.description: Find an element by placeholder and click on it.

actions.name: DoClickByValue
actions.description: Find an element by value attribute and click on it.

actions.name: DoClickByTitle
actions.description:
Find an element by title attribute and click on it. Title is usually visible as
an element's tooltip.

actions.name: DoClickByName
actions.description:
Find an element by name attribute and click on it. The name is usually invisible
so you need to know it in advance.

actions.name: DoClickByClassName
actions.description: Find an element by CSS class name and click on it.

actions.name: DoClickById
actions.description: Find an element by ID and click.

actions.name: DoClickByXPath
actions.description: Find an element by XPath and click.

actions.name: DoClickByTextTitlePlaceholder
actions.description:
Find an element text, title or placeholder and click on it.
This is the most generic method for finding something on the page by visible
text and clicking on it. It covers buttons, links and various controls that
include title (title is usually shown as a tooltip), placeholder or hint.
Example 1:
WebPageHelper.DoClickByTextTitlePlaceholder('Enter username...'); // This should capture a placeholder
Example 2:
WebPageHelper.DoClickByTextTitlePlaceholder('Login'); // This should capture a button
Example 3:
WebPageHelper.DoClickByTextTitlePlaceholder('Press to log into the system'); // This should capture a tooltip

actions.name: DoFileDragAndDrop
actions.returns: 'true' if the upload was successful; otherwise, it returns false.

elOrXPath.description: The target element to receive the file. This can be an object reference or an XPath selector string. Typically a `label` or `div` element where the file may be dropped.

filePath.description: The path to the local file to upload. This can be an absolute path or a relative path with respect to a framework directory.

actions.name: DoTripleClick
actions.returns: 'true' if the upload was successful; otherwise, it returns false.

elOrXPath.description: The target element to click. This can be an object reference or an XPath selector string.

actions.name: DoClick
actions.returns: 'true' if the upload was successful; otherwise, it returns false.

objIdXPathLabelText.description: The target element to click. This can be an object reference or an XPath selector string or element id or `css=<some css>` or `//xpath` or label (<label for=>***</label> or aria-label=***).

actions.name: WaitForVisible
actions.returns: 'true' if the upload was successful; otherwise, it returns false.

objIdXPathLabelText.description: The target element to click. This can be an object reference or an XPath selector string or element id or `css=<some css>` or `//xpath` or label (<label for=>***</label> or aria-label=***).

timeout.description: Maximum time to wait, in milliseconds

actions.name: WaitWhileVisible

WebPageHelper.description:
WebPageHelper is designed to help doing various actions and checks
with the currently open web page without need to use XPath or objects. The
methods of WebPageHelper are in general slower than those having exact XPath, 
but it is useful for writing sanity checks and quick validation scenarios.
The power of those methods are that they are cross-frame and are inteded to 
cover the whole visible contents of the page, rather than only the root frame.
